revised_title: Molluscan Fauna and Environmental Implications of Middle Pleistocene Deposits at Little Oakley, Essex
tldr: The molluscan fauna of the middle Pleistocene interglacial deposits at Little Oakley, Essex, is described, providing insights into the environment and stratigraphy of the area. The fauna indicates a large, well-oxygenated river, thought to be the ancestral Thames, and suggests a Cromerian age. The study also highlights significant differences in faunas at different sampling sites and discusses the implications of these findings.
